metadata.notes: Required for all students receiving special education services under IDEA

definition: a written plan developed for each student with a disability that outlines specific educational goals, services, and accommodations

metadata.notes: Parents have the right to request an IEE at public expense if they disagree with the school's evaluation

definition: an evaluation conducted by a qualified examiner who is not employed by the school district responsible for the student's education

metadata.notes: Students with disabilities should be educated with non-disabled peers to the maximum extent appropriate

definition: the educational setting that allows a student with disabilities to be educated with non-disabled peers to the greatest extent possible while still meeting their needs

metadata.notes: Originally enacted as the Education for All Handicapped Children Act in 1975

definition: federal law ensuring students with disabilities receive free appropriate public education tailored to their individual needs

metadata.notes: Core requirement under IDEA - education must be both free and appropriate to the child's needs

definition: special education and related services provided at public expense that meet state educational standards and the individual needs of the student

metadata.notes: Broader than IDEA - covers students who have disabilities but may not need special education services

definition: federal civil rights law prohibiting discrimination against individuals with disabilities in programs receiving federal funding

metadata.notes: Broader civil rights law that applies to public and private entities, not just federally funded programs

definition: comprehensive civil rights law prohibiting discrimination based on disability in employment, public services, and public accommodations

metadata.notes: Parents or schools can request a due process hearing when they disagree about a student's education

definition: a formal legal proceeding where an impartial hearing officer resolves disputes between parents and schools regarding special education services

metadata.notes: Voluntary process that can help resolve disputes without going to a due process hearing

definition: a voluntary process where a neutral third party helps parents and schools resolve special education disputes through discussion and negotiation

metadata.notes: Required when a student's behavior impedes their learning or that of others

definition: a systematic process to identify the purpose or function of a student's problem behavior and develop appropriate interventions

metadata.notes: Must be based on the results of a functional behavioral assessment

definition: a written plan that uses positive behavioral interventions and supports to address problem behaviors based on the results of a functional behavioral assessment

metadata.notes: Must begin by age 16, or earlier if appropriate, and be updated annually

definition: coordinated activities designed to help students with disabilities move from school to post-school activities including higher education, employment, and independent living

metadata.notes: Includes services like speech therapy, occupational therapy, physical therapy, and transportation

definition: transportation and developmental, corrective, and other supportive services required to assist a student with disabilities to benefit from special education

metadata.notes: Required within 10 school days of a disciplinary action that constitutes a change of placement

definition: a review to determine if a student's misconduct was caused by or had a direct relationship to their disability or was the result of the school's failure to implement the IEP

metadata.notes: Provided when a student would experience significant regression without continuous educational services

definition: special education and related services provided beyond the normal school year to prevent significant regression of skills or knowledge

metadata.notes: Must be provided whenever the school proposes or refuses to initiate or change identification, evaluation, or placement

definition: written notice that schools must provide to parents before proposing or refusing to initiate or change their child's identification, evaluation, or educational placement

metadata.notes: Must be provided at least once per year and upon initial referral, request for evaluation, and filing of a complaint

definition: a document that explains parents' rights under special education law, including their right to participate in meetings and request evaluations

metadata.notes: Required before initial evaluation, initial provision of services, and reevaluations

definition: agreement by a parent who has been fully informed of all information relevant to the activity for which consent is sought, in their native language

metadata.notes: Must occur at least every three years, unless parent and school agree it's not necessary

definition: a comprehensive assessment conducted at least every three years to determine if a student continues to have a disability and needs special education services

metadata.notes: Provided in regular education classes to help students with disabilities succeed alongside their non-disabled peers

definition: aids, services, and supports provided in regular education classes or other education-related settings to enable students with disabilities to be educated with non-disabled students

metadata.notes: Includes parents, teachers, school administrators, and other professionals as appropriate

definition: a group of individuals responsible for developing, reviewing, and revising a student's Individualized Education Program

metadata.notes: Must be completed within 60 days of receiving parental consent, unless state law provides otherwise

definition: the first comprehensive assessment conducted to determine if a student has a disability and needs special education services

metadata.notes: Awarded when a school has failed to provide FAPE and the student has been denied educational benefit

definition: additional educational services provided to remedy a school's failure to provide a free appropriate public education

metadata.notes: Ranges from regular classroom with supports to residential placement

definition: the range of placement options available to meet the needs of students with disabilities, from least to most restrictive

metadata.notes: Student remains in current placement during dispute resolution proceedings

definition: the requirement that a student remain in their current educational placement during the pendency of any due process hearing or court proceeding
